data.prayer: Father, bring yourself glory in Vilniaus. Through your servants plant 161 new churches that love you, love one another, and make disciples this year.
data.verse: For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Vilniaus, Lithuania
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the state of Vilniaus to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 70 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Lord, like in the church of Antioch, where you gathered many prophets and teachers, please gather many prophets and teachers in the state of Vilniaus, Lithuania.
data.verse: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Vilniaus, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Uzbek, Northern people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Vilniaus, Lithuania. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Father, reveal your kingdom to those with a childlike heart in the state of Vilniaus.
data.verse: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.

data.prayer: Lord, make the 11,415 believers in Vilniaus to be brave and clear with the gospel to their 794,985 neighbors.
data.verse: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

location.name: Vilniaus
location.people_groups_list: Estonian, Tatar, Kazakh, Jew, Eastern Yiddish-speaking, Azerbaijani
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Estonian (500), Tatar (2,200), Kazakh (500), Jew, Eastern Yiddish-speaking (2,500), Azerbaijani (1,000)
